Description: Doll; hollow bone; tubular with pierced shoulders; incised facial features and grooved lines around the neck and stomach; top and back of skull covered with a bitumenous substance to resemble hair.
Curator's comments: On dolls of this type: A. Shatil, "Bone Figurines of the Early Islamic Period: The So Called 'Coptic Dolls' from Palestine and Egypt", in: S. Vitezović, ed. Close to the Bone: Current Studies in Bone Technologies (Belgrade 2016) 296-314.
Exhibition history: 2015 1 April - 15 Sept. Berlin, Bode Museum, 'EIN GOTT - Abrahams Erben am Nil'
Acquisition name: Donated through: W H Heeles & Son
